marketNews.title: DPR Proposes Lower Increase in Cigarette Excise and Gradual Increase in Sweetened Beverage Tax
marketNews.content:
The House of Representatives (DPR) recommended that the excise duty rate on tobacco products (CHT) for machine-made white cigarettes (SPM) and machine-made kretek cigarettes (SKM) be increased by a minimum of 5 percent per year in 2025 and 2026. This proposal is lower than the average CHT increase of 10 percent in 2023 and 2024. Meanwhile, the DPR suggested a limited increase for hand-rolled kretek cigarettes (SKT) in 2025 and 2026, considering labor absorption.

In addition to CHT, the DPR also proposed a minimum excise tax on sweetened beverages in packaging (MBDK) of 2.5 percent in 2025, to be gradually raised until it reaches 20 percent. This proposal differs from the earlier draft, which considered a MBDK excise of 1,771 rupiah per liter, in line with the average MBDK excise rates in Southeast Asian countries.

The latest MBDK excise discussion does not specify the product criteria that will be taxed. However, the previous draft defined taxable MBDK products as: 1) MBDK without added sweeteners but containing more than 6 grams of sugar per 100 milliliters, and 2) MBDK containing any natural or artificial sweeteners in any amount.

The proposed CHT and MBDK rates remain recommendations; the final decision rests with the Minister of Finance in the new cabinet. The government has set a target excise revenue of 244.2 trillion rupiah in the 2025 state budget, a 5.93 percent increase compared with the 2024 outlook of 230.5 trillion rupiah.

Key takeaway: The lower projected CHT increase could provide relief for the cigarette industry, which has been burdened by continuously high excise hikes in recent years.

marketNews.title: Mr DIY Home Improvement Chain Plans IPO in Late 2024
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the home improvement retailer Mr DIY intends to launch an initial public offering on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) at the end of 2024 or early 2025, targeting a fund raise of 300 million US dollars. Mr DIY first entered the Indonesian market in 2017 and now operates 800 stores across the country.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Ministry of Finance Budget 2025 Increases to 1,160.08 Trillion Rupiah
marketNews.content: The Director of the Ministry of Finance, Isa Rachmatarwata, said on Tuesday (9/10) that the budget for ministries and agencies in 2025 will reach 1,160.08 trillion rupiah, a significant rise from the 976.78 trillion rupiah allocated in the 2025 state budget. The announcement came one day after Finance Minister Sri Mulyani presented the 2025 budget results to President-elect Prabowo Subianto. Isa assured that the budget increase will not widen the fiscal deficit because it is shifted from non‑ministerial and non‑agency allocations. The five ministries or agencies with the largest budgets are the Ministry of Defense (166.26 trillion rupiah), the National Police (126.62 trillion rupiah), the Ministry of Public Works and Housing (116.22 trillion rupiah), the Ministry of Health (105.6 trillion rupiah), and the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology (93 trillion rupiah).

marketNews.title: Brent Crude Oil Prices Fall 3.69% to $69.19 per Barrel
marketNews.content: Brent crude oil prices dropped 3.69 percent to $69.19 per barrel on Tuesday night (10/9), marking the lowest level since December 2021. The decline followed OPEC+ lowering its 2024 global oil demand growth forecast from 2.11 million barrels per day to 2.03 million barrels per day, and also reducing the 2025 forecast from 1.78 million barrels per day to 1.74 million barrels per day. The downward revision was driven by weaker oil demand from China, the world's largest oil importer, amid a slowing economy and a shift toward cleaner energy sources.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Retail Sales Contraction in July 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that retail sales in Indonesia contracted by 7.2 percent month‑on‑month in July 2024, while still growing 4.5 percent year‑on‑year. The central bank said the monthly decline was caused by the normalization of demand after the Iduladha holiday. For August 2024, Bank Indonesia forecasts retail sales to increase 1.6 percent month‑on‑month and 5.8 percent year‑on‑year.

marketNews.title: Rumah123 Calls for Postponement of VAT Increase to 12%
marketNews.content: Senior Vice President of Marketing at Rumah123, Bharat Buxani, said the company hopes the government will postpone the increase of value‑added tax (VAT) from 11 percent to 12 percent for six months to one year, as it could slow growth in the property sector. Buxani noted that the timing is not right to raise VAT, given that consumer purchasing power is currently on a downward trend.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to Establish Committee for Implementing Nuclear Power Program
marketNews.content: The Jakarta Post reported that the Indonesian government plans to announce a Committee for Implementing the Nuclear Energy Program next week. The committee will be chaired by the President and operated by the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, tasked with overseeing and accelerating the development of nuclear projects in Indonesia. According to the National Research and Innovation Agency, Indonesia aims to test and operate its first commercial nuclear power plant between 2030 and 2034.

marketNews.title: Sinarmas Group to Build Advanced Data Center in Jakarta
marketNews.content: Katadata reported that the Sinarmas Group will build a data center worth 300 million US dollars (approximately 4.7 trillion rupiah) in Kuningan, South Jakarta in the first quarter of 2025. The data center will be developed through a joint venture with LG CNS Co., Ltd, under the name PT LG Sinarmas. The project is scheduled for completion in the third quarter of 2026 and to start operations in the fourth quarter of 2026. The CEO of PT LG Sinarmas, Han Dong‑Hyup, claimed the facility will be Indonesia's first data center operated by artificial intelligence, with the majority of clients coming from the banking sector affiliated with the Sinarmas Group or Korean investors.

marketNews.title: Tourism Law Discussion Postponed by Government
marketNews.content: The Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy, Sandiaga Uno, said the discussion of the Tourism Law will be postponed and continued by the next administration and the House of Representatives. He explained that the decision was made so that the aspirations of tourism business actors can be properly accommodated in the draft regulation. Previously, the Indonesian Tourism Industry Association had requested a postponement because the draft was not yet aligned with industry stakeholders' expectations.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Optimistic About Gold Production Exceeding 2024 Target
tickerNews.content: BRMS: The Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Herwin Hidayat, said the company is optimistic that gold production in 2024 can exceed the target of 35,000 troy ounces. The optimism is based on higher grades and gold content at the River Reef and Hill Reef mines owned by the subsidiary PT Citra Palu Minerals in Palu, Central Sulawesi. River Reef has a gold grade of 4.9 grams per ton and a gold content of 4.2 million troy ounces, of which 89 percent can be mined. Hill Reef adds an additional reserve of 329,000 troy ounces. BRMS recorded gold production of 26,744 troy ounces in the first half of 2024, a 251 percent year‑on‑year increase, achieving 76.4 percent of the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: INKP Plans Issuance of Bonds up to 2.5 Trillion Rupiah, Sukuk up to 1 Trillion Rupiah, and USD Bonds up to $20 Million
tickerNews.content: INKP: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper plans to issue bonds up to 2.5 trillion rupiah, sukuk up to 1 trillion rupiah, and US‑dollar denominated bonds up to 20 million dollars. The proceeds will be used for debt repayment and working capital. The bonds and sukuk will each consist of three series (370‑day, 3‑year, and 5‑year tenors) with interest rates not yet disclosed. The bond and sukuk issues have received idA+ and idA+ (sy) ratings from Pefindo.

tickerNews.title: BEKS Plans Rights Issue of Up to 5.2 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: BEKS: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Banten plans a rights issue of up to 5.2 billion new shares, with dilution effect, ratio, and issue price not yet disclosed. The proceeds will be used to increase capital and liquidity and to reduce interest burden. The controlling shareholder, the Provincial Government of Banten, will exercise its rights through an in‑kind contribution by transferring assets worth a total of 114.1 billion rupiah, consisting of three buildings and a parking lot. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders' meeting on 17 October 2024.

tickerNews.title: TPMA Receives Three New Vessels in Early Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: TPMA: The Director of Trans Power Marine, Rudy Sutiono, said the company received three new vessels at the beginning of the third quarter of 2024, consisting of two barges and one tugboat, with a capital expenditure of 5 million US dollars. In 2024, TPMA targets the addition of six barges, two tugboats, and one floating crane, with a capex allocation of 20 million US dollars. The company also plans to add new routes based on customer orders, but not for implementation this year.

tickerNews.title: PKPK Announces First Coal Shipment to China Worth $2.4 Million
tickerNews.content: PKPK: The mining services company Perdana Karya Perkasa, through its subsidiary PT Tri Oetama Persada, announced the first shipment of coal valued at 2.4 million US dollars (37.4 billion rupiah) for export to China. PKPK stated that PT Tri Oetama Persada's coal production and sales are projected to reach 550,000 tons with revenue of 446 billion rupiah in 2024, and 3 million tons with revenue of 2.4 trillion rupiah in 2025.

tickerNews.title: OJK Urges Bukalapak to Deploy Remaining IPO Funds by End of 2025
tickerNews.content: BUKA: The Financial Services Authority (OJK) warned Bukalapak to fully realize the remaining IPO proceeds of 9.8 trillion rupiah, currently held in bonds and deposits, by December 31, 2025. Previously, at the extraordinary shareholders' meeting on December 23, 2021, shareholders approved the use of IPO funds as follows: 33 percent for the company's working capital, 34 percent for subsidiaries' working capital, and 33 percent for business growth of Bukalapak and/or its subsidiaries.

tickerNews.title: Ruhong Holding Increases Stake in BINO to 89.63% after Purchasing 383.5 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: BINO: The controlling shareholder of Perma Plasindo, Ruhong Holding Pte. Ltd., bought 383.5 million BINO shares at an average price of 147 rupiah per share on September 5, 2024. After this transaction, Ruhong Holding's ownership in BINO rose from 72 percent to 89.63 percent. Previously, Ruhong Holding conducted a mandatory tender offer for up to 435 million (20 percent) BINO shares at 147 rupiah per share between July 27 and August 25, 2024.

tickerNews.title: BBLD Secures Credit Facility of Up to 300 Billion Rupiah from HSBC Indonesia
tickerNews.content: BBLD: Buana Finance obtained a credit facility of up to 300 billion rupiah from PT Bank HSBC Indonesia, intended for consumer finance and financial lease lending.
